datamodule module¶

datamodule.load_data()¶
Description

downloads the digit-recognizer data from kaggle as 2 zip files one contains the test.csv which has 28000 test image and the other contains 42000 train and validation images, then it unzips the data into their specific folders after splitting the train and validation datasets.

Returns

the train, validation and test datasets in dataframe format

datamodule.normalize_data(train_array_, validation_array_)¶
Description

normalize the train and validation arrays by dividing pixels values by 255.

Parameters

  • train_array (numpy array of 33600 images with their pixels, its shape (33600x784)) – input numpy array of train samples.

  • validation_array (numpy array of 8400 images with their pixels, its shape (8400x784)) – input numpy array of validation samples.

Returns

the train and validation numpy arrays after normalization

datamodule.transform_data(train_, validation_, test_)¶
Description

splits the features and the labels of the train and validation datasets then transforms the dataframes into numpy arrays.

Parameters

  • train (dataframe of 33600 images with their pixels, its shape (33600x785)) – input dataframe of train samples.

  • validation (dataframe of 8400 images with their pixels, its shape (8400x785)) – input dataframe of validation samples.

  • test (dataframe of 28000 images with their pixels.) – input dataframe of test samples.

Returns

5 numpy arrays which are train_labels_array (33600x1), validation_labels_array (8400x1)

train_array (33600x784), validation_array (8400x784), test_array (28000x784)
